title: Eben Dugbatey
text:
Ebenezer Dorkutso Dugbatey (born 31 July 1973) is a <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>ian former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who played for clubs in Africa and Europe.
Club career.
Dugbatey was born in <a href="Accra">Accra</a>. He played for <a href="FC%20Lorient">FC Lorient</a> in the French <a href="Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> and <a href="Ligue%202">Ligue 2</a>. He had a brief spell with <a href="Samsunspor">Samsunspor</a> in the Turkish <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a>.
International career.
Dugbatey made seven appearances for the full <a href="Ghana%20national%20football%20team">Ghana national team</a>, including two matches at the <a href="2000%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2000 African Cup of Nations</a> finals, where he was the first player to be sent off in the tournament. He also made two appearances in qualifying matches for the <a href="2002%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2002 FIFA World Cup</a>.
